ehm.donations-help: This CHPP will always be free. However, any contribution towards its maintenance and improvement is appreciated.
ehm.exclusive-mode-help: the selected players do not appear in the player list
ehm.forum-help: Access this CHPP's forum. Updates are posted there and are open to any feedback, questions, suggestions, improvements or errors.
ehm.inclusive-mode-help: only selected players are displayed in the player list
ehm.log-in-warning: Your own credentials are required for this wizard. Do not use Hattrick credentials.
ehm.manual-1020: this manual explains the main features of Easy Hattrick Manager; hereafter we will refer to it as
ehm.manual-1100: once registration and sign-in are completed, you arrive at the main page.
ehm.manual-1120: a core part of EHM; it displays all information for each player as a card.
ehm.manual-1130: the information shown corresponds to the selected project and selected time point.
ehm.manual-1210: the user who has signed in to EHM is shown.
ehm.manual-1230: here you can change the system language.
ehm.manual-1240: this choice is saved for future visits.
ehm.manual-1250: by default, the language configured in Hattrick at registration time is used.
ehm.manual-1260: regarding translations, internally they are divided into two major groups
ehm.manual-1290: this includes skill names, player skill values, specialties, ...
ehm.manual-1300: this allows us to support all languages available on the platform.
ehm.manual-1330: translations into Spanish, Catalan, and English are done manually
ehm.manual-1340: for other languages, the open-source tool
ehm.manual-1360: if a language is not available, English is used by default.
ehm.manual-1370: feel free to report any translation errors.
ehm.manual-1390: allows you to change the currency shown in the system.
ehm.manual-1400: by default, the currency configured in Hattrick at registration time is used.
ehm.manual-1410: function to fetch the most recent data from Hattrick.
ehm.manual-1420: it is an option that, as a rule,
ehm.manual-1430: does not need to be used
ehm.manual-1440: since EHM aims to streamline this task; therefore,
ehm.manual-1450: it schedules an automatic execution to update Hattrick data.
ehm.manual-1460: the automatic run is scheduled weekly, specifically between 1 and 3 hours after the time defined in Hattrick.
ehm.manual-1470: it also has a retry policy in case of process failures.
ehm.manual-1480: likewise, and the main reason for providing this option in the menu is to be able to trigger it manually
ehm.manual-1490: if you notice that the data is not up to date.
ehm.manual-1500: after a manual update, you need to refresh EHM so the new data is shown.
ehm.manual-1510: EHM only allows one weekly data save per team to avoid duplicate data,
ehm.manual-1520: and within the week, the reference is the day of Hattrick's training update.
ehm.manual-1530: allows you to download a JSON file with all the information collected from your teams.
ehm.manual-1540: it is advisable to save this file regularly as a backup.
ehm.manual-1560: ends the current session and returns to the sign-in page.
ehm.manual-1590: link to the EHM code repository; the deployed version (vXX) is indicated.
ehm.manual-1610: link to the Hattrick user profile of the EHM creator.
ehm.manual-1620: this screen allows us to modify the list of projects we have in EHM.
ehm.manual-1630: a project is defined as a period of time for a specific team.
ehm.manual-1640: it's a way to configure how data is displayed.
ehm.manual-1650: there is no problem changing this configuration and playing with it, since the data is not altered,
ehm.manual-1660: I repeat: it's just a way to configure the view we want.
ehm.manual-1670: you can create as many projects as you need, and it's fine if they overlap in time.
ehm.manual-1681: upon registering, a project is created for each team, starting that same week and with no end date.
ehm.manual-1700: here you can modify the project configuration. By default it loads the current configuration.
ehm.manual-1710: it is shown as a table, where each row corresponds to a project.
ehm.manual-1720: the order of the projects in the list is respected when displaying them in the
ehm.manual-1740: button to add a new project.
ehm.manual-1780: dropdown to select the team the project belongs to.
ehm.manual-1800: dropdown to select the project's start week.
ehm.manual-1820: option to enable or not the project's end week.
ehm.manual-1830: if it is a current project, this option should appear disabled; that way EHM will show new data after each weekly update.
ehm.manual-1840: on the contrary, if it is a past, already finished project, this option should appear enabled so that we can select a specific end week.
ehm.manual-1860: dropdown to select the project's end week.
ehm.manual-1880: button to delete the project. Remember this action does not delete any data from the system.
ehm.manual-1900: button to return to the EHM main page without saving the new configuration.
ehm.manual-1920: button to save the new configuration and return to the EHM main page.
ehm.manual-1930: player sorting lets you set the order in which players are shown in the (1) player list.
ehm.manual-1940: EHM takes care of saving the sorting configuration per project.
ehm.manual-1960: there are two sorting modes, ascending or descending.
ehm.manual-1970: either numerically or alphabetically, depending on the chosen criterion.
ehm.manual-1980: if there are empty values, they are shown at the end; this applies, for example, to sorting by shirt number if a player has no number assigned.
ehm.manual-1990: by default, ascending mode is selected.
ehm.manual-2000: lets you choose the criterion by which players are sorted.
ehm.manual-2010: the player ID is used to break ties when the chosen criterion has the same value for multiple players.
ehm.manual-2020: by default, the player ID is selected.
ehm.manual-2030: player filtering lets you select which players you want to show in the (1) player list.
ehm.manual-2040: EHM takes care of saving the filtering configuration per project.
ehm.manual-2060: there are two filtering modes: inclusive mode and exclusive mode.
ehm.manual-2070: inclusive mode is used to show only the selected players.
ehm.manual-2080: this mode is very useful for projects where we want to track a small group of players and ignore the rest.
ehm.manual-2090: exclusive mode is used to hide the selected players.
ehm.manual-2100: this mode is very useful for projects where we want to show all players except a few.
ehm.manual-2110: by default, exclusive mode is selected.
ehm.manual-2120: shows the full list of project players to apply the selection, ordered by player ID.
ehm.manual-2130: this module lets us move along the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2160: by default, and whenever a project is selected, the most recent week is shown.
ehm.manual-2180: button to go back to the start of the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2190: button to go back one season on the project's timeline from the selected point,
ehm.manual-2200: or, failing that, if there is less than one season of data, to the start of the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2210: button to go back one week on the project's timeline from the selected point.
ehm.manual-2220: you can also use the left arrow on the keyboard.
ehm.manual-2230: button to move forward one week on the project's timeline from the selected point.
ehm.manual-2240: you can also use the right arrow on the keyboard.
ehm.manual-2250: button to move forward one season on the project's timeline from the selected point,
ehm.manual-2260: or, failing that, if there is less than one season of data, to the end of the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2280: button to move forward to the end, that is, the most recent point, of the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2290: this module lets us navigate between the different projects we have configured.
ehm.manual-2310: by default, the first project in the list loads and, when it does, the time point selector moves to the most recent point,
ehm.manual-2320: at the same time, the saved configurations for filter and player sorting are loaded.
ehm.manual-2330: when clicking on the combo, the list of existing projects appears,
ehm.manual-2340: keeping their order as defined in the
ehm.manual-v2-index-5: 5. Training Planner, player prime and lineup prime
ehm.manual-v2-intro: Updated visual manual. Every block includes an English screenshot with numbered markers and a detailed explanation for each marker.
ehm.manual-v2-item-1: Active project selector. Changing project reloads the full workspace context, including project timeline, calculated values, and the saved player filter/sort configuration associated with that project.
ehm.manual-v2-item-2: View-mode switch. It alternates between the operational players view (day-to-day monitoring) and the Training Planner simulation view (long-term planning and optimization).
ehm.manual-v2-item-3: Season/week navigator with quick jumps. Use it to move across the selected project timeline and compare past, current and projected states. Quick controls allow jump-to-start, jump-by-season and jump-to-end movements.
ehm.manual-v2-item-4: Shortcut to open the player filtering panel. Filtering is applied instantly to visible player cards and is persisted per project so each project can keep its own focus group.
ehm.manual-v2-item-5: Shortcut to open the sorting panel. Sorting criterion and direction are applied in real time to the player list and are also persisted per project.
ehm.manual-v2-item-6: Main menu toggle. Opens the global settings and quick actions area: language, currency, date format, visibility options, data update/export and navigation links.
ehm.manual-v2-item-7: Weekly summary cards. They aggregate team totals and averages (economy, age, form, stamina, etc.) plus contextual staff/training information for the currently selected week.
ehm.manual-v2-item-8: Player cards grid. Each card combines personality/status data, key skill levels, HTMS indicators and direct links to historical player detail, enabling quick scouting and follow-up.
ehm.manual-v2-item-9: Main menu panel expanded. This visible state confirms you are editing account-wide preferences and running quick actions from a single central panel.
ehm.manual-v2-item-10: Language selector. Changes UI labels and generated texts. If a translation key is missing in a specific language, English is used as fallback.
ehm.manual-v2-item-11: Currency selector. Converts and displays financial values in the chosen currency to simplify budget comparison between projects and periods.
ehm.manual-v2-item-12: Date format selector. Applies a consistent date style across the application, which is useful when comparing exports, screenshots or shared reports.
ehm.manual-v2-item-13: Training-info visibility toggle. Enables or hides training-related indicators on player cards, including values that depend on minutes, position and training settings.
ehm.manual-v2-item-14: Subskills visibility toggle. Shows or hides sublevel information for finer progression analysis and more precise interpretation of training impact.
ehm.manual-v2-item-15: Project-management entry point. Opens the project editor where timeline windows are created and maintained without modifying raw imported data.
ehm.manual-v2-item-16: Manual data update action. EHM already runs a scheduled weekly sync (with retry policy) a few hours after Hattrick's configured update, so this button is mainly for exceptional cases where data looks outdated. After running it, refresh the page to view newly imported values. To avoid duplicates, EHM stores at most one weekly snapshot per team, using the Hattrick training-update day as reference.
ehm.manual-v2-item-17: Data export action. Downloads a JSON file containing all collected team/project data currently loaded by EHM. It is recommended to save this file periodically as a backup and restore point before major project edits or experimental planning changes.
ehm.manual-v2-item-18: Sorting-panel trigger in header. It opens ordering controls on top of the current page, so you can re-order cards without navigating away.
ehm.manual-v2-item-19: Order-direction selector. Choose ascending or descending mode depending on whether you need to prioritize low values or high values.
ehm.manual-v2-item-20: Sorting-criteria selector. Supports identity, economy, skill, HTMS and training metrics. If several players share the same value, player ID is used as deterministic tie-breaker.
ehm.manual-v2-item-21: Filtering-panel trigger in header. Opens inclusion/exclusion controls and immediately applies the result to the visible player set.
ehm.manual-v2-item-22: Filter-mode selector. Inclusive mode keeps only checked players; exclusive mode hides checked players and keeps the rest.
ehm.manual-v2-item-23: Player checklist used by the filter. The list includes all players in project scope and is intended for quick tactical subsets (for example, trainees or transfer candidates).
ehm.manual-v2-item-24: Bulk quick actions. Select all, clear all and invert selection greatly reduce setup time when working with large squads.
ehm.manual-v2-item-25: Training Planner mode switch. Enters simulation mode where you can define staged training plans and evaluate projected skill and lineup evolution.
ehm.manual-v2-item-26: Stage-builder form. In this manual example there are exactly two stages and each one spans 48 weeks (3 seasons): first playmaking, then defending.
ehm.manual-v2-item-27: Stage timeline with controls. It shows configured segments and lets you adjust order, edit parameters or remove stages before recalculating projections.
ehm.manual-v2-item-28: Plan summary panel. Displays end season/week and accumulated figures (for example total wage, weeks and seasons) expected at the end of the configured plan.
ehm.manual-v2-item-29: Players-block toggle. Collapsing players is useful when you need to focus on lineup ratings, prime windows and tactical comparisons.
ehm.manual-v2-item-30: Per-player stage sliders. They distribute training participation per stage and directly affect projected development for the selected player.
ehm.manual-v2-item-31: Initial compact player card. Represents the baseline snapshot before applying the full plan so you can compare starting vs projected state.
ehm.manual-v2-item-32: Projected compact player card. Represents the expected state after all configured stages are applied.
ehm.manual-v2-item-33: Player-level prime marker. The star highlights the personal best point for that player inside the simulated horizon, helping decide timing and role planning.
ehm.manual-v2-item-34: Players panel collapsed state in lineup view. This layout maximizes vertical space for tactical charts and rating analysis.
ehm.manual-v2-item-35: Lineup/ratings section expanded. It exposes the evolution curve, best-week marker and tactical outputs for final lineup assessment.
ehm.manual-v2-item-36: Final-lineup prime range. The highlighted band indicates the optimum time window where the projected team performance peaks.
ehm.manual-v2-item-37: Best-week marker for final lineup. It points to the exact week selected as the top tactical point inside the prime range.
ehm.manual-v2-item-38: Final lineup and ratings pitches. Left field shows positional distribution of the best lineup, right field shows rating sectors (defense/midfield/attack by zone).
ehm.manual-v2-item-39: Existing projects list. A project is a display/planning time window for a specific team, and multiple projects can overlap without altering stored historical data. At registration, EHM creates one default project per team (starting that same week, no end date).
ehm.manual-v2-item-40: Project editor table. This is the main configuration area: each row is one project, with editable name, team selector, start week and optional end week. The order defined here is the same order used later in the project selector.
ehm.manual-v2-item-41: Delete row action. Removes the selected project row from the editable configuration. This does not delete imported player/team data from the system; it only removes that project definition.
ehm.manual-v2-item-42: Return without saving. Leaves the project editor and discards every pending modification made in this session.
ehm.manual-v2-item-43: Save and return. Persists the entire project-table configuration and then goes back to home with the updated setup available.
ehm.manual-v2-item-44: End-week enable checkbox. For active/current projects this is usually disabled (open-ended project so new weekly data keeps appearing). For historical/closed projects, enable it and choose an explicit end week to freeze the timeline.
ehm.manual-v2-item-45: Add new row action (+). Appends a new project line in the table so you can define another scenario (team + date window) without touching existing ones.
ehm.manual-v2-item-46: Player header and context area. Identifies the analyzed player and anchors the historical chart to that specific profile.
ehm.manual-v2-item-47: Historical chart plotting area. It contains complete week-by-week time series across the selected period, enabling longitudinal progression analysis.
ehm.manual-v2-item-48: Right-side grouped legend. It controls visibility of skills, status variables, coach/global metrics and training-related indicators for cleaner comparisons.
ehm.manual-v2-item-49: Central trend-reading zone. Useful for comparing slopes, plateaus and breakpoints between multiple metrics over time.
ehm.manual-v2-item-50: Upper high-impact area. This region usually concentrates breakthrough jumps and strategic milestones, making it ideal for fast visual diagnosis.
ehm.manual-v2-note: Texts and values can vary by language, currency, active project, selected week and source data freshness.
ehm.manual-v2-section-5: 5. Training Planner, player prime and lineup prime
ehm.missing-params: required parameters to complete registration are missing.
ehm.name: name
ehm.navigate-help: you can navigate using the right and left arrow keys on your keyboard
ehm.no-remember-password: If you don't remember your password, please register again. Your EHM data is linked to your Hattrick user, so by registering again, you'll recover all the data you already had in EHM.
ehm.now-on: from now on, Easy Hattrick Manager will save your teams' history on a weekly basis
ehm.show-sub-skills-help: Schum's formulas were used for the calculation.
ehm.show-training-info-help: The calculation of training received takes into account minutes played, position, training type, coach level, assistant coach level, training intensity, and stamina part.
ehm.training-planner-help: To get started, add training stages using the form on the left.
ehm.training-planner-welcome: Welcome to the Easy Hattrick Manager training planner.
ehm.user-exists: the user already exists, please choose another.
ht.fan-season-expectations-0: Ne možemo se nositi s ovom ligom
ht.fan-season-expectations-1: Svaki bod u ovoj ligi je uspjeh
ht.fan-season-expectations-2: Morat ćemo se boriti za opstanak
ht.fan-season-expectations-3: Mjesto nam je u sredini tablice
ht.fan-season-expectations-7: Puno smo bolji od svih u ligi!
